254: Company Description The Power Tools Division of the Bosch Group is one of the worlds leading providers for power tools, power tool accessories and measuring tools. The core success factors are innovative strength and pace of innovation. With brands such as Bosch, Dremel, the division stands for customer focus and great engineering progress. Job Description Perform all manufacturing/assembly auditing functions in accordance with acceptable Quality Standards. Understand and perform all job duties in accordance with prescribed safety guidelines (OSHA, State of Arkansas, etc.) Must be able to interact and communicate effectively with Production workers, Supervisors, Managers, and Customers as required. Maintain high ethical/quality standards in all assigned work and related documents. Support co-workers as assigned by Department Leader or Supervisor. Ability to work scheduled hours as assigned in accordance with all Bosch policies (i.e. Attendance, Overtime, etc.) Qualifications High School Diploma, G.E.D. Must be able to read and write in English. Must posses the ability to interpret customer requirements from Engineering drawings to determine acceptable parts and assemblies per quality standards. Must have the ability to perform shop math, parts/assembly print reading, precision instrument measuring, and SPC functions. Must posses physical mobility to allow for smooth transition of parts/assemblies through assigned work areas. May require , with assistance, lifting up to 50 pounds. Must have the ability to learn and perform computer input and processing functions.
